alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Brevard and east central Osceola Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rockledge, moving southeast at 20 mph. An additional strong storm is near Deer Park and will move eastward. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Melbourne, Rockledge, Cocoa, Cocoa Beach and Satellite Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
